channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lampost bulb needs replacing Queens Rd., 3rd September
item.description:
It's on the bridge above the Honeybourne walk by the Station on the corner of Queens rd and Kensington Ave Absolutey pitch black at night. As it's on the bridge you may have a problem changing bulb unless you use a cherry picker and access it from Kensington Avenue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken drain surround - creating a pothole., 3rd September
item.description:
There is a broken drain surround, creating a pothole. This is eastbound on the main road of Cold Pool Lane, just before the Hatherley mini roundabout, just past the new housing estate on Symphony Road, Hatherley. Could the drain surround be repaired please ? It's been broken for quite a while now. Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Flag attached to bus shelter, 3rd September
item.description:
When leaving Wentworth Court, turning left, along Village Road there is a large flag attached to the bus shelter which causes a visual distraction for drivers. Please can this be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Diversion not working!! HGV driving through village, 3rd September
item.description:
Please note since spring bridge closure on London road- Large heavy HGV not taking notice or too late on detour and driving though east end road/church street/horse fair street/lyefield rd west. This has led to horrific congestion, fumes and long traffic jams. The narrow roads in the centre of Charlton kings are unsuitable for large vehicles. I have seen 5 close accident calls alone in a 20 min walk . 2 where HGVS have gotten stuck trying to navigate around st Maryâ€™s church and by the v narrow merry fellow pub. They had to reverse . This is dangerous during the day but at rush hour and with a large population of 4 schools- it is an accident waiting to happen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenfall Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed
